text:
How To Fall Asleep Faster - 
Improvement pill here are you someone
who spends hours tossing and turning in

bed even though you know you have to
wake up early tomorrow you probably end

up getting less sleep than what you need
and you wake up feeling groggy and tired

all day well today I'm gonna show you
3 tips that you've probably never

heard of that will actually make a huge
difference so let's jump right into it

the first thing you have to do if you
want to be able to fall asleep like a

baby at night is to get sunlight in the
morning a study conducted by the

American Academy of Sleep Medicine in
2013 took a look at day shift workers in

multiple offices they found that the
workers who sat close to windows got on

average a hundred and seventy three
percent more sunlight throughout the day

than those who did not they then found
that those same people who are receiving

more sunlight were sleeping on average
46 minutes longer

the reason they slept so much longer was
because their internal clock was running

on time what I mean by this well our
body releases different hormones at

different times throughout the day often
referred to as the circadian rhythm or

as I like to call it the hormonal clock
in the morning when sunlight hits the

receptors in your skin and eyes our body
says okay it's the morning it's time to

release some cortisol this is actually a
good thing it's kind of like our body's

built-in coffee machine it's what makes
you feel awake and alert it plays a role

in your ability to focus and concentrate
without it you will feel tired even if

you've had a full night of sleep the
problem nowadays is that people aren't

getting enough sunlight in the morning
to start the clock at the right time we

live in confined houses often with
curtains over our windows we walk

quickly to the train station or take our
cars to work where we spend the majority

of the day in an office without any
sunlight this means that the cortisol

that's supposed to be released early on
in the morning isn't being released on

time our internal clock is running late
and this affects what happens to us

later on in the day see in the afternoon
when the Sun Goes Down our body is

supposed to start producing melatonin
which is often referred to as the sleep

hormone it's what makes us feel sleepy
now when your internal clock is running

late you start releasing melatonin at a
later time so instead of it starting at

8:00 p.m. when it's supposed to if you
want to be able to fall asleep by 12 it

starts at 10:00 p.m. which means you
won't start feeling tired until 2:00

a.m. so the moment you wake up make sure
you open up all your blinds

sit next to the window while you get
ready for the day and let the natural

sunlight hit your body try to get at
least twenty to thirty minutes of

sunlight in order to get your internal
clock started on time this will make

sure that you'll start producing
melatonin at the right time later on in

the day so that you can fall asleep with
ease when bed time comes around the

second tip is something that might
surprise a lot of you but Before we jump

into that I do want to give a quick
shout out to the sponsors of today's

video ants and belt I'll be honest with
you guys this doesn't have anything to

do with sleep but its brands like ants
and that allow me to continue to make

content for you guys for absolutely free
dozens of companies send me their

products every month and only the ones
that I actually think are worth it make

the cut I used to have a bunch of normal
belts a belt for work a casual belt a

fun belt and my collection of belts
looks something like this but Anson

allows you to mix and match straps and
buckles however you want so instead of

having to buy nine different belts I can
simply order three buckles and three

straps which gives me enough options for
almost every occasion on top of that

these belts are homeless which means
that there are no holes no pulling and

stretching of the straps so your belts
will stay looking presentable for much

much longer on top of that these belts
are micro adjustable which means you'll

get a perfect fit every time if you'd
like to help out the channel and if

you're sick of dealing with old school
belts then I suggest you go see why

Anson belts has nearly thirteen thousand
five star ratings go to Anson belt comm

and check out their box set which gives
you six belt combinations for under $100

alright so let's get back to the topic
at hand the second thing you need to do

if you want to be able to fall asleep
easier at night is to lose weight more

specifically to decrease your percentage
of body fat this is all because of the

effect an overabundant of fat has on
your hormones a study conducted by

Deakin University found that after
healthy individuals in a meal their

cortisol levels raised by just 5% which
is natural they then looked at

overweight individuals and found that
after a meal their cortisol levels

raised by a whopping 51% like I
mentioned before cortisol has an inverse

relationship with melatonin this means
that if you're overweight you're going

to be secreting a ton of cortisol right
after eating a nighttime meal like

dinner or a snack and this is gonna
prevent your body from producing

melatonin at night which in turn means
that you're not gonna be able to fall

asleep until much later being overweight
also leads to another major problem with

sleep apnea which currently plagues over
18 million Americans this is when you

stop breathing
for short periods of time while you

sleep this causes you to wake up
multiple times throughout the night

which you guessed it makes you feel
tired in the morning the extra fat that

accumulates around your neck has been
directly linked to this sleep disorder

so that's another major reason why you
need to keep your weight in check you

need to be adjusting your tight and
start sticking to a fitness regimen to

keep your weight at healthy levels not
just so that you can look good but so

that you can get better sleep which
funny enough has been shown to make you

easier to maintain a healthy weight the
third and final secret that I'm gonna be

sharing with you guys is to manipulate
your body temperature like the hormonal

clock our body also has different
temperatures throughout different times

of the day we are warmer during the
morning when we are up and about and

cooler during the night when we are
asleep this means that our body needs to

be cooler in the evenings if we want to
be able to fall asleep in fact a study

conducted in 1994 found that the most
optimal temperature of a room for humans

to fall asleep in is anywhere from 60
degrees to 69 degrees Fahrenheit 15

point 5 Celsius to 20 Celsius to show
you just how powerful temperature

manipulation can be we can take a look
at another study conducted at the

University of Pittsburgh which looked at
a group of insomniacs who all had issues

falling asleep the test subjects were
instructed to sleep on specially

designed cooling mats that decreased
their body temperature and the results

were shocking then Sami X who usually
took anywhere from one to three hours to

fall asleep were averaging out at just
13 minutes to fall asleep that's even

better than the control group who was
filled with healthy individuals the

healthy people took on average 16
minutes to fall asleep that's how

powerful manipulating your temperature
can be now there are a couple of ways

you can do this the first is of course
to turn down the heat

don't leave the thermostat on too high
or the a/c on too low try to make sure

that your room is somewhere around 65
degrees another cool trick is to take a

warm shower 1 to 2 hours before you plan
on going to bed this may sound kind of

odd why are we taking a warm shower if
we want to cool down but it turns out

that this actually causes your body to
cool down just in time for bedtime

another way you can control your
temperature is by making sure that you

have a high-quality mattress that
properly ventilates a lot of cheap

mattresses out there have too much
insulation and get hot easily invest in

a good mattress or even sleep on the
floor and you'll find your

of being able to fall asleep much much
easier and that's it guys if you get

more Sun in the morning reduce your body
fat and learn to manipulate your body

temperature I guarantee that you'll find
yourself falling asleep just like a baby

try it out and let me know if it works
for you besides that guys stay tuned
